summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding travel approval requests for victim interviews and meetings related to the investigation of Jeffrey Epstein (United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618). The emails span from March to July 2019 and detail planned trips to Florida (Palm Beach, West Palm Beach, Fort Lauderdale) and Los Angeles for the purpose of interviewing victims.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: He is the recipient and approver of multiple travel request emails from AUSAs for the Epstein investigation. He grants approval for travel and conference room reservations.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: She is consistently copied on the travel approval request emails between the AUSAs and Edward Tyrrell.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: She is a prosecutor on the Epstein case, frequently mentioned as traveling to conduct victim interviews in Florida and Los Angeles. She is a signatory on several travel requests.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: He is a prosecutor on the Epstein case, the primary author of most travel request emails, and coordinates travel for himself, Alison, and Maurene to conduct victim interviews.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: She is mentioned as part of the travel team for victim interviews, alongside Alex and Alison, for trips to Los Angeles and West Palm Beach.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the federal investigation 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618' for enticement of minors for sexual activity, which is the reason for the travel.

connections.description: They are co-prosecutors on the Epstein case, frequently traveling together as a team to conduct victim interviews.
They are part of the same investigation team, with Alex coordinating travel that includes Maurene for victim interviews.
They are mentioned as potential travel pairs for victim interviews in West Palm Beach.
Alex submits travel approval requests to Edward Tyrrell, who is in a supervisory/approving role.
Michele Duncan is consistently copied on Tyrrell's correspondence regarding the travel approvals, indicating a working relationship.

events.title: Victim Interviews in Palm Beach, Florida
events.description: Travel approved for AUSAs to conduct victim interviews in Palm Beach, Florida, from Wednesday through Sunday, including reservation of a hotel conference room.

events.title: Victim Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: Travel approved for the investigation team to fly to Los Angeles for a victim interview, tentatively from Wednesday to Friday, with a hotel conference room reserved.

events.title: Meetings and Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: Travel approved for approximately three days to West Palm Beach, Florida, for meetings and victim interviews following the Memorial Day holiday.

events.title: Meetings and Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: Travel approved for approximately three days to West Palm Beach, Florida, for meetings and interviews related to the Epstein case.

events.title: Initial Travel for Case Meetings
events.description: Initial travel request for two days of meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, Florida, for the Epstein investigation.

locations: Southern District of New York (likely NYC office)
keyFacts: The document reveals active victim interview efforts by the SDNY in the Epstein case (2018R01618) from March to July 2019, spanning multiple locations in Florida and California.
It shows a consistent pattern of travel requiring supervisory approval and the use of hotel conference rooms for conducting interviews, indicating a formal, organized investigation process.
The email chain identifies a core investigation team of AUSAs Alex, Alison, and Maurene, supervised by Edward Tyrrell, with Michele Duncan kept in the loop.
The case is formally referenced as 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618, an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity'.
The casual note '*** we would never miss the BBQ.' in a July 2019 email suggests the travel was planned around a social event, indicating the duration of the trip.
